private_information: There are 8 disks labeled A (smallest) through H (largest).
Initial stack on left peg top-to-bottom is A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H.
Middle and right pegs are initially empty.
Legal moves move a single top disk from one peg to another and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
planner.goal: Recreate the entire stack on the right peg in the same order top-to-bottom A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H.

private_information: A single move transfers exactly the top disk of one peg to the top of another peg.
Physical capability constraint: only one disk can be moved at a time.
Must always respect size ordering when placing a disk on a peg.
executor.goal: Support execution-level constraints and confirm atomic move semantics for planning.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that encodes the 8-disk Tower of Hanoi instance and its goal.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 8 disks labeled A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H where A is the smallest and H is the largest.
Initial configuration: left peg has top-to-bottom A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H, middle peg is empty, right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg empty, middle peg empty, right peg has top-to-bottom A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H.
Rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert in formalizing puzzles for planners. Produce a clear structured description of the objects, types, predicates, and candidate action schemas required to represent this Tower of Hanoi instance. Do not emit PDDL itself. Emphasize how to represent disk sizes, peg locations, top-of-peg relations, on relations, and the constraints that prevent placing larger disks on smaller ones.
analysis.prompt: Your name is planner. You operate with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->planner->private_information} Your goal is: {agents->planner->goal} Provide a model description listing objects, recommended types, predicates with intended meanings, and action schema templates that an orchestrator could translate into PDDL. Do not output PDDL.

capability_report.system_prompt: You are an expert in execution constraints and atomic move semantics. Provide a concise report describing the allowed primitive moves, any necessary preconditions and effects at execution level, and safety constraints to ensure only valid single-disk moves occur. Do not emit PDDL.
capability_report.prompt: Your name is executor. You operate with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private information: {agents->executor->private_information} Your goal is: {agents->executor->goal} Produce a capability report that enumerates atomic move assumptions, preconditions, effects, and any invariants the planner must respect. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in writing PDDL for the FastDownwards solver. Using the analysis and capability report from other agents, produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeted for FastDownwards. The PDDL must include types for disks and pegs, predicates that capture disk order and top-of-peg relations, action definitions that enforce single-disk moves and size constraints, an initial state encoding the 8-disk left stack, and a goal encoding the full stack on the right peg. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions atomic and avoid assumptions not supported by inputs.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive a model description and an execution capability report. Use them to produce the final PDDL domain and PDDL problem for the following task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Here is the planner's analysis: {planner_analysis} Here is the executor's report: {executor_report} Integrate these inputs, resolve naming or representation differences, and emit a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
